template.p: Welcome to the Odoo Bike Shop package!

This module offers all the essential tools a bike shop needs to run daily operations in one place. It covers everything from selling bikes; both online through an eCommerce website and in-store with a point of sale system, to managing repairs, maintenance services, and inventory.

Bike Shops can handle customer orders, schedule test rides, receive and track service requests, and follow up on repairs. Inventory and parts can be monitored and reordered when needed. And all customer communication and invoicing are handled directly within the system, keeping everything organized and connected.
It‚Äôs a simple way to keep sales, services, and stock under control while offering a smooth experience to clients.
You can access every installed App in your Odoo database on your main dashboard.

li.p: The Point of Sale (PoS) manages bike and accessory sales directly in the store.
The Sales App create and manage quotations and sales orders.

The

ell bikes and accessories online with a customizable web store.

organizes and tracks repair tasks, deadlines, and parts used in the workshop.

anages vendor orders and restocks bikes and parts.

template.p: Manage in-store transactions for bikes, accessories, or specific parts with the Point of Sale (PoS) app.

li.p: Open the Point of Sale App and start a session by clicking on your register.

Add products to the cart by scanning barcodes or searching manually and manage bikes with product variants (e.g. frame size, color) to keep a single product reference while tracking specific configurations for stock, pricing, and availability.
Proceed to payment by using the selected method; cash, card or on the Customer Account if you let the user pay later (e.g. if you order the specific model from the manufacturer for the client.)
Inventory levels update automatically after each sale.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3 o-contenteditable-false

div.p: Configure Optional Products: Suggest relevant accessories such as helmets, locks, or lights by configuring them as optional products, which appear during checkout to encourage upselling.

template.p: Sell bikes and services online using the Website and eCommerce apps, providing a complete digital shopping experience for your clients.

ol.li: Configure your website to present your bike catalog, services, and brand mission with a clean and structured layout.
Organize products by category (e.g., VTT, Cargo, Electric) to help users quickly find the right bike type.
Enable test ride bookings by integrating the Appointment app, so users can reserve a slot to try a bike directly from the product page.
Set up payment and delivery methods: let customers choose between home delivery or in-store pickup, and secure transactions with trusted payment gateways.

h4.strong: Manage Orders via the Sales App

template.p: Handle Services of Repairs and Maintenance through the Sales app, with integration to inventory, field service, and communication tools.

ol.li: Open the Sales app from the main dashboard.
Create a Sales Order manually or use a Quotation Template for recurring order. (Ex: Basic Bike Maintenance (Non-Electric) Template)
Confirm the Sales Order to trigger the appropriate actions:
For bike or parts sales, a delivery order is generated, reserving the product from stock and updating the inventory accordingly.
For repairs or maintenance, a task is created automatically under the "Workshop" Field Service project, linked to each operation in the order.
Once all tasks related to the Sales Order are "Marked as Done" column, the order becomes Collectible. An automation sends an email to the customer, notifying them that the bike is ready for pickup.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Track and invoice parts added during repair: Using the Field Service project, you can log extra parts used during the repair. These parts are added to the Sales Order and invoiced when the customer collects their bike.
div.div: Customize customer notifications: Personalize the "Order Ready" email by enabling Debug Mode, navigating to Email Templates, and editing "Sales Order: Order Ready". You can also configure automated messages via SMS and WhatsApp using Odoo‚Äôs marketing automation and messaging integrations

template.p: Handle all repair and maintenance operations efficiently with the Field Service app.

li.p: Open the Field Service app and check your assigned tasks or priorities.
Select a task to begin the repair. Log each product used (e.g., brake pads, chains) directly on the task. These will be automatically added to the related Sales Order and invoiced later.
For specific repairs, track the time spent on the task using the Timesheet feature, allowing accurate billing based on time spent.
Mark the task as Done when completed. Once all tasks linked to the Sales Order are in this stage, a notification email will automatically be sent to the customer confirming that their bike is ready.
Complete the repair and maintenance worksheet using a Worksheet Template (e.g., checklist of performed operations, technician name, signature field,...). The client can sign it upon collection.

When the customer returns to pick up the bike, open the Point of Sale (PoS) app, load the related Sales Order (quotation), and proceed with the payment. Odoo allows retrieving existing quotations in the PoS for seamless final payment processing.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Filter repair tasks by Serial Number to view a bike‚Äôs repair history; helpful for recurring maintenance actions like annual oil checks on specific components.

Customize your project stages in the ‚ÄúWorkshop‚Äù project: add columns like ‚ÄúWaiting for Parts‚Äù to better track blocked repairs waiting for a parts delivery, or ‚ÄúReady for Pick-Up" when the repair is done.
Use the Survey app to send a satisfaction survey after the repair is completed and the bike is returned.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.strong: Handle warranty cases through the Helpdesk app:

ol.li: Open the ‚ÄúWarranties / After-Sales / SAV‚Äù team in the Helpdesk app to manage all warranty tickets.

Create a ticket to verify the warranty. You can also automate ticket creation by sharing the email alias (e.g. warranties@bike-shop.odoo.com); when clients send an email, a ticket is created automatically.

Link the ticket to the related Sales Order Line and the matching Workshop task (e.g. repair on the client‚Äôs Cube bike). Move the ticket to the ‚ÄúSent to Brand‚Äù column and use an Email Template to contact the brand for warranty confirmation.
Based on the brand‚Äôs response, check or uncheck the "Warranty" box on the Workshop task to reflect whether the repair is covered.

template.p: Manage bike parts and inventory efficiently using the Purchase and Inventory apps to avoid shortages and streamline restocking.

ol.li: Create a Purchase Order from the Purchase app when specific parts (e.g., tires, brakes) are running low.
Select your preferred vendor based on pricing or delivery performance to optimize purchase conditions.
Once the purchase is confirmed, send the Request for Quotation (RFQ) via email or confirm it manually.
When the goods arrive, click the ‚ÄúReceipt‚Äù smart button to validate the incoming shipment and add parts to your inventory.
Go to the Inventory app and open the product (e.g., brake pads). Use the Smart Buttons on the product page to access the Reordering Rules.
Set the minimum and maximum stock levels. Define the quantities that will trigger automatic restocking (e.g., Min: 10, Max: 50).
Let Odoo handle reorders automatically. When forecasted stock drops below the minimum, Odoo will generate a Purchase Order based on your settings.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Add vendor lead times on each product to anticipate delivery delays and organize procurement planning accordingly (e.g., 5-day lead time for imported suspension forks).

li.p: Sell a bike in-store with the PoS app. Choose size and color easily, and suggest extras like a helmet.
Create a Sales Order for a maintenance or specific repair directly from the Sales app.
Odoo creates tasks automatically in the Workshop (Field Service app).
Do the repair, add any parts used, and mark the task as Done when done.
The customer gets an email letting them know the bike is ready.
Finish the payment when the customer picks up the bike; directly from the PoS using the linked order.
Stock updates automatically, and missing parts are reordered based on minimum levels you‚Äôve set.
